title: Mattapan
summary: Mattapan (/ˈmætəpæn/) is a neighborhood in Boston, Massachusetts. Historically a section of neighboring Dorchester, Mattapan became a part of Boston when Dorchester was annexed in 1870. Mattapan is the original Native American name for the Dorchester area,[1] possibly meaning "a place to sit."[2] As of the 2010 census, it had a population of 36,480, with the majority of its population immigrants.
